Why is the answer to everything a rework?
because thats how you solve the problem of a bad kit. whether his kit is bad enough for a rework or not is up for debate.

My only problem with that solution is that used too much it starts to become a crutch that can always be raised as an option. Look at how many champions are told they need reworks on a weekly basis. Problem champions don't include as many people as the forums say it does. "Their kit just plain can't be balanced, they need a rework." 

Don't get me wrong, some champions absolutely needed it, but when you start bringing up Fizz, for example, simply because his kit is frustrating then you lose the point of the reworks, because there's more that goes into the decision than "Is he frustrating to play against? If yes, rework."

Also, this isn't meant to insinuate that you believe that that is all it takes for him to receive a rework, but a large amount of people do, so I'm sorry if it comes off as me believing you're that type of person.

It also might have to do with the amazing quality of reworks to come out of riot recently. Everyone wants a chance to have their champion Sion'ed or Ashe'd or maybe even Ryze'd at the risk of it being Cassiopia'd. 

A kit is healthy when it can be buffed or nerfed into a viable state just by sheer numbers without being oppressive. This usually means a lot of power but a lot of counter play. Perhaps we have too many kits that do not fit this criteria, and thats why so many reworks are called for. I agree frustrating to play against is not a good enough reason to rework... but i believe Riot has shown that they believe it IS a good reason for a rework or at least a nerf. So now the goal for a rework is fun to play as, fun (or at least able) to play against, viable. Riot has opened the door for anyone who believes that a champion does not fit those three things should be reworked.

Well at least thats my theory

Here's the thing, this isn't DOTA.

This game isn't balanced around counterpicks, at least not anymore.

Basically, it really doesn't matter if Yi has counterpicks, because if you don't counterpick him, he's going to make your life miserable.

Same goes for {{champion:84}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:122}}  {{champion:114}}  and the list goes on and on.

The problem with these champions aren't the fact that they carry hard, or can be insanely potent in the right hands, but the fact that they're so binary.

You counter Darius?  He's going to be miserable the entire game.

Darius counters you?  You're going to be miserable the entire game.

Honestly, the best example of perfect amounts of counterplay is the matchup between {{champion:51}} and {{champion:21}}.

Both have clearly exploitable weaknesses that each of them can capitalize on, and the match-up is 100% skill based.

Now, not every champ is going to work that well.  But even in instances where a champion has an edge over another one, it still is skill dependent.

For example, I main Gangplank.  I am perfectly ok with laning against a Pantheon.  I am not ok with laning against a Fiora.

With Pantheon, I know that if I make smart descions, I'll eventually outscale him, and probably be able to kill him if I'm more skilled with GP than my opponent is with Pantheon.  There's a possibility there.

With Fiora, I know that if I make smart decisions, at best I'll be able to farm effectively under tower, and at worst I'll feed her horribly.  Out of the couple dozen or so matchups I had specifically against Fiora, I've only truly won one of them, and that's because my opponent was wickedly inexperienced with her, while I have pretty much gotten GP mastered.

Teal Deer:  Reworks aren't just thrown around, they're used for the most egregious of balance problems this game has or has had (see AP Master YI, old Critplank, old Soraka).  Riot doesn't rework because they just feel like it, they do it because there's literally no other option.  Soraka was always going to be useless or the unstoppable lane freezer.  Gangplank was always going to be the level 1 insta win or run OOM cheeseball.  AP Master Yi was never going to go away unless he was reworked.
